catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 263
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: remnants of burned scroll mounted to paper decorated with gold flakes; colorful scenes of men and women interacting alternating with cursive text panels
medium: Ink, color, and gold on silk
provenance: Baba Zuiō; Kuki Ryūichi; Kuki Saburō (Baron Kuki, Director of the Tokyo National Museum (in the Meiji period) and his son, Saburo Kuki.)
title: The Tale of Usugumo
